body_html: I've posted to stackoverflow. That's probably where this question belongs. Nevertheless, I feel like there should be an operation defined by tensorflow for multipying a 3D tensor by a vector. Unless I'm overlooking it, it doesn't seem to exist. matmul won't work with a 3D tensor and batch_matmul won't accept the vector.
body_text: I've posted to stackoverflow. That's probably where this question belongs. body: I've [posted to stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34110502/bilinear-tensor-product-in-tensorflow). That's probably where this question belongs. Nevertheless, I feel like there should be an operation defined by tensorflow for multipying a 3D tensor by a vector. Unless I'm overlooking it, it doesn't seem to exist. matmul won't work with a 3D tensor and batch_matmul won't accept the vector.
